sentences.en: "Your Eminence," Pantieri broke in, "I wonder if you would allow me a word."
sentences.cn: “主教阁下，”潘铁尼插话道，“不知您能否容许我说一句。”

sentences.en: Beveridge was a man of great eminence.
sentences.cn: 贝弗里奇是个非常有名的人。

sentences.en: He is a statesman of great eminence.
sentences.cn: 他是个声名显赫的政治家.

sentences.en: He seemed both rueful and fatalistic about his prospective eminence.
sentences.cn: 他对自己将担任的要职,似乎抱着一种既郁郁不乐,又听天由命的情绪.

sentences.en: His Eminence Cardinal Hume celebrated Mass.
sentences.cn: 休谟红衣主教大人主持了弥撒。

sentences.en: His Eminence graced the banquet by his presence.
sentences.cn: 主教阁下的出席给宴会增添了光辉.

sentences.en: Many of the pilots were to achieve eminence in the aeronautical world.
sentences.cn: 这些飞行员中很多人将会在航空界声名显赫。

sentences.en: Nixon had not reached eminence , however, by being taken in by generalities.
sentences.cn: 然而尼克松所以能发迹, 不是因为他听了一些笼统的原则就信以为真.

sentences.en: She was strongly committed to her job, a policewoman by eminence.
sentences.cn: 她非常忠于职守, 一位卓越的女警察.

sentences.en: They were even boastful of its eminence in those particulars.
sentences.cn: 他们甚至夸耀这些特色为它的优点.

sentences.en: They were suspicious of all eminence.
sentences.cn: 凡是与众不同的,他们都怀疑.

sentences.en: To the left a little eminence appeared, spotted with golden goose.
sentences.cn: 左边出现了一座点缀着金雀花的小丘.

sentences.en: With little effort, he attained political eminence.
sentences.cn: 不费什么力, 他就在政治上露了头角.

trans.tran_en: the quality of being famous and important
